intro: Scutia myrtina, commonly known as redroot scutia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces red or orange berries that are attractive to birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Scutia myrtina thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
